title: Transition from shadow mode to enforced integrator ownership so no non-integrator path can merge or push canonical `main`.

five_acts.act_1_context: The project needed to move from shadow-mode safety validation to strict integrator ownership so legacy paths could not mutate canonical main.
five_acts.act_2_build: Implemented cutover authorization primitives, runtime cutover controls, and shell guardrails across git, gh, and pre-push layers for canonical-main operations.
five_acts.act_3_conflict: Review challenged coverage depth around parity-not-ready and gh-path checks while validating that the architecture remained boundary-consistent.
five_acts.act_4_resolution: The delivery achieved APPROVE in round one with no Critical or Important findings, with follow-up hardening captured as explicit suggestions.
five_acts.act_5_outcome: Canonical main authority is now guarded by integrator cutover controls while preserving feature-branch workflows and providing auditable diagnostics for blocked paths.
